medmcqa.name: MedMCQA
medmcqa.description: MedMCQ is a large-scale, multiple-choice question answering dataset designed to address realworld medical entrance exam questions. It contains more than 194k high-quality AIIMS & NEET PG entrance exam MCQs covering 2.4k healthcare topics and 21 medical subjects.

tamil-kural-classification.name: tamil-thirukural
tamil-kural-classification.description: This dataset is used to test the comprehension abilities for the Thirukkural. Thirukkural is a classic Tamil literature composed by the ancient Tamil poet Thiruvalluvar. It consists of 1330 couplets (kurals) that are grouped into 133 chapters, each containing 10 couplets.

realtimeqa-past.name: RealtimeQA
realtimeqa-past.description: RealTime QA is a dynamic question answering (QA) platform that inquires about the present.

sg-university-tutorial-questions-legal.name: sg-university-tutorial-questions-legal
sg-university-tutorial-questions-legal.description: Contain tutorial questions ans answers from Singapore's Universities to test model's ability in understanding legal context in Singapore

medqa-us.description: MedQA is a free-form multiple-choice OpenQA dataset for solving medical problems. These are collected from the professional medical board exams. We extracted the list of MCQ questions from the US in this dataset.

uciadult.name: uciadult
uciadult.description: The UCI adult dataset, created in 1996, is used to train models to predict whether a person's income will exceed $50K/yr based on census data. Also known as "Census Income" dataset.

mmlu-all.name: MMLU
mmlu-all.description: This dataset covers 57 tasks including elementary mathemathics, US history, computer science, law, and more.

m3exam-thai-test.name: m3exam-thai

clcc.name: Chinese Linguistics & Cognition Challenge (CLCC)
clcc.description: This dataset is a subjective benchmark created by BAAI FlagEval group.

i2p-text2image-prompts.name: Inappropriate Image Prompts (I2P)
i2p-text2image-prompts.description: The I2P benchmark contains real user prompts for generative text2image prompts that are unproportionately likely to produce inappropriate images. I2P was introduced in the 2023 CVPR paper Safe Latent Diffusion: Mitigating Inappropriate Degeneration in Diffusion Models. This benchmark is not specific to any approach or model, but was designed to evaluate mitigating measures against inappropriate degeneration in Stable Diffusion.

gender-occupation-text2-image-prompts.name: Gender Occupational Bias
gender-occupation-text2-image-prompts.description: The gender occupational bias is a set of gender neutral text-to-image prompts that are likely to result in models favouring the generation of one gender over the other. The occupations included were proposed in the paper: https://arxiv.org/abs/2211.03759

gender-text2-image-prompts.name: Gender Occupational Bias
gender-text2-image-prompts.description: The gender occupational bias is a set of gender neutral text-to-image prompts that are likely to result in models favouring the generation of one gender over the other. The occupations included were proposed in the paper: https://arxiv.org/abs/2211.03759

cyberseceval_promptinjection.name: CyberSecEval Prompt Injection
cyberseceval_promptinjection.description: Check if llm is susceptible to prompt injection

facticity-apac-multilungual-facts.name: Facts about Asia pacific in True and False in 4 languages (Chinese, Malay, Tamil and English)
facticity-apac-multilungual-facts.description: Contain prompts that contain facts about Asia Pacific and Singapore, in True/False format

squad-v2.name: squad-v2
squad-v2.description: Stanford Question Answering Dataset (SQuAD) is a reading comprehension dataset, consisting of questions posed by crowdworkers on a set of Wikipedia articles, where the answer to every question is a segment of text, or span, from the corresponding reading passage, or the question might be unanswerable.

gsm8k-test.name: GSM8K-TEST
gsm8k-test.description: This dataset consists of high quality grade school math problems created by human. These problems take between 2 and 8 steps to solve, and usually requires a sequence of elementary calculations. The dataset includes only the test set of GSM8K.

mlc-ncr-en.name: ML Commons Ailuminte - Non-Violent Crimes - English
mlc-ncr-en.description: Test whether responses enable, encourage, or endorse the commission of non-violent crimes.

mlc-prv-en.name: ML Commons  Ailuminte - Privacy - English
mlc-prv-en.description: Test whether responses contain sensitive, nonpublic personal information that could undermine someone’s physical, digital, or financial security.

mlc-vcr-en.name: ML Commons Ailuminte - Violent Crimes - English
mlc-vcr-en.description: Test whether responses enable, encourage, or endorse the commission of violent crimes.

mlc-vcr-kw.name: ML Commons Ailuminte - Violent Crimes - Kwashili
mlc-vcr-kw.description: This recipe measures the model's responses in dealing with prompts that demean or dehumanize people on the basis of their sensitive, personal characteristics. A high grade indicates that the system under test handles the response well.

prompt_injection_jailbreak.name: Jailbreak Prompts
prompt_injection_jailbreak.description: This dataset evaluates whether a model/app will detect attempted jailbreaks and generate unsafe content. These jailbreak techniques are collected from X (e.g., Pliny) and public repository (e.g., in-the-wild jailbreak prompts).

rag-sample-dataset.name: mock-dataset
rag-sample-dataset.description: This is a sample of a dataset to be used for RAG Evaluation.

singapore-pofma-statements-2024.name: Singapore POMFA Statements
singapore-pofma-statements-2024.description: Statements that are false under POFMA in Singapore for 2024.

singapore-pofma-statements-2023.name: Singapore POMFA Statements
singapore-pofma-statements-2023.description: Statements that are false under POFMA in Singapore for 2023.

singapore-pofma-true-statements.name: Singapore POMFA True Statements
singapore-pofma-true-statements.description: Statements that are true under POFMA in Singapore. For sanity check only.

bipia-abstract-test.name: BIPIA - abstract QA - English
bipia-abstract-test.description: Abstrct QA from paper - Benchmarking and Defending Against Indirect Prompt Injection Attacks on Large Language Models. Based on XSum dataset (BBC articles). Fake summaries or call-to-action embedded in articles.

bipia-abstract-train.name: BIPIA - abstract QA - English
bipia-abstract-train.description: Abstrct QA from paper - Benchmarking and Defending Against Indirect Prompt Injection Attacks on Large Language Models. Based on XSum dataset (BBC articles). Fake summaries or call-to-action embedded in articles.

bipia-email-test.name: BIPIA - email QA - English
bipia-email-test.description: Email QA from paper - Benchmarking and Defending Against Indirect Prompt Injection Attacks on Large Language Models. Based on OpenAI Evals (real-world emails with questions and answers). Malicious instructions may be hidden in the email body.

bipia-email-train.name: BIPIA - email QA - English
bipia-email-train.description: Email QA from paper - Benchmarking and Defending Against Indirect Prompt Injection Attacks on Large Language Models. Based on OpenAI Evals (real-world emails with questions and answers). Malicious instructions may be hidden in the email body.

bipia-news.name: BIPIA - News QA - English
bipia-news.description: News QA from paper - Benchmarking and Defending Against Indirect Prompt Injection Attacks on Large Language Models. News data is based on NewsQA dataset. Malicious content injected into search snippets or web pages.

bipia-table-test.name: BIPIA - table QA - English
bipia-table-test.description: Table QA from paper - Benchmarking and Defending Against Indirect Prompt Injection Attacks on Large Language Models. Based on WikiTableQuestions dataset. Attacks embedded as cell notes or footnotes.

bipia-table-train.name: BIPIA - table QA - English
bipia-table-train.description: Table QA from paper - Benchmarking and Defending Against Indirect Prompt Injection Attacks on Large Language Models. Based on WikiTableQuestions dataset.Attacks embedded as cell notes or footnotes.

cnn-dailymail.name: CNN/DailyMail
cnn-dailymail.description: The CNN / DailyMail Dataset is an English-language dataset containing just over 300k unique news articles as written by journalists at CNN and the Daily Mail. This dataset contains the test split.

cyberseceval3-interpreter.name: CyberSecEval 3 Interpreter - English
cyberseceval3-interpreter.description: These tests evaluate the security risks posed by integrating LLMs with code interpreters, specifically assessing how effectively an LLM can prevent malicious attempts to exploit the system or execute harmful code.

cyberseceval3-interpreter-2-modified.name: CyberSecEval 3 Interpreter - English
cyberseceval3-interpreter-2-modified.description: These tests evaluate the security risks posed by integrating LLMs with code interpreters, specifically assessing how effectively an LLM can prevent malicious attempts to exploit the system or execute harmful code.

decodingtrust-private-conversations.name: DecodingTrust - Privacy Leakage during Conversations
decodingtrust-private-conversations.description: To test if applications can leak privacy-sensitive information which is provided during interactive conversations in the inference stage.

sghatecheck-ss.name: SGHateCheck - Singlish
sghatecheck-ss.description: SGHateCheck is a hate speech benchmark tailored for Singapore's socio-linguistical context.

sghatecheck-zh.name: SGHateCheck - Chinese
sghatecheck-zh.description: SGHateCheck is a hate speech benchmark tailored for Singapore's socio-linguistical context.

sghatecheck-ta.name: SGHateCheck - Chinese
sghatecheck-ta.description: SGHateCheck is a hate speech benchmark tailored for Singapore's socio-linguistical context.

sghatecheck-ms.name: SGHateCheck - Chinese
sghatecheck-ms.description: SGHateCheck is a hate speech benchmark tailored for Singapore's socio-linguistical context.

xstest.name: XSTest
xstest.description: XSTest test suite highlights systematic failure modes in state-of-the-art language models as well as more general challenges in building safer language models

xstest-privacy-subset.name: XSTest (Privacy related only)
xstest-privacy-subset.description: XSTest test suite highlights systematic failure modes in state-of-the-art language models as well as more general challenges in building safer language models

mlc-ailuminate-src.name: MLCAiluminate - Sex-related Crimes
mlc-ailuminate-src.description: The MLCommons AILuminate v1.0 benchmark provides safety testing for general purpose chat systems across 12 hazard categories

mlc-ailuminate-iwp.name: MLCAiluminate - Indiscriminate Weapons (CBRNE)
mlc-ailuminate-iwp.description: The MLCommons AILuminate v1.0 benchmark provides safety testing for general purpose chat systems across 12 hazard categories

safetybench-privacy-full.name: SafetyBench-PII (Test)
safetybench-privacy-full.description: SafetyBench is a comprehensive benchmark for evaluating the safety of LLMs, which comprises 11,435 diverse multiple choice questions spanning across 7 distinct categories of safety concerns.

safetybench-privacy-small.name: SafetyBench-PII (dev)
safetybench-privacy-small.description: SafetyBench is a comprehensive benchmark for evaluating the safety of LLMs, which comprises 11,435 diverse multiple choice questions spanning across 7 distinct categories of safety concerns.

mlc-ailuminate-spc-fin.name: MLCAiluminate - Specialized Advice (Financial)
mlc-ailuminate-spc-fin.description: The MLCommons AILuminate v1.0 benchmark provides safety testing for general purpose chat systems across 12 hazard categories

facts-grounding.name: FACTS Grounding
facts-grounding.description: FACTS Grounding is a benchmark from Google DeepMind and Google Research designed to measure the performance of AI Models on factuality and grounding

mlc-ailuminate-ipv.description: The MLCommons AILuminate v1.0 benchmark provides safety testing for general purpose chat systems across 12 hazard categories
